head.supplied: Melbourne botanic Garden ¶ 2 Dec 1863. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to allow a transfer to be made of fifteen pounds Sterling from the forage vote of this establish...

div.p: D63/9140, unit 749, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
See also M to J. McCulloch, 25 October 1863 (in this edition as 63-10-25b). Melbourne botanic Garden

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to allow a transfer to be made of fifteen pounds Sterling from the forage vote of this establishment to that of incidental expenses, and that accordingly the sum of £10.- .- of authority C.S. 513 & of £5 of authority 350 may be cancelled.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: your most obedient and humble servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
